verses.roman:
sanātana-mukhe kṛṣṇa āmā śikhāilā
tāhā vighna kari' vana-pathe lañā āilā

synonyms: sanātana-mukhe—from the mouth of Sanātana; kṛṣṇa—Lord Kṛṣṇa; āmā—unto Me; śikhāilā—gave instructions; tāhā—that; vighna kari'-making a hindrance; vana-pathe—on the path through the forest; lañā—taking; āilā—came.
translation: "Thus I was going to Vṛndāvana with a big crowd, but through the mouth of Sanātana, Kṛṣṇa taught Me a lesson. Thus by making some impediment, He has brought Me on a path through the forest to Vṛndāvana.
